page.title: 07Hill Sheep Farming: FINTRY
page.content:
In this area sheep stocks are mainly { {Blackface(Scotch).}Most are crossed (bred) with{Leicesters}and produce{ {Greyfaced lambs.}Others are purebred. Some ewes (pronounced "YOWS" around here) produce twins, so a lambing can have more than 100% yield.{Farmers {would expect a 130% yield,}but it can reach 150% in a good year.
The stocking rate on{unimproved land is around{2 acres per breeding ewe.} This can improve to{1 acre per {breeding ewe on better reseeded soils.
The individual height of hill tops affects the amount of peat present. The{draw moss and cotton grass}also found here, is of particular value in the early spring and summer months.
Please note rams are "TUPS" hereabouts
